title: Eclipse Attack
summary: An attacker isolates a target node's peer connections to control its view of blocks and transactions.
attackerCapabilities: Control or influence many peer connections around the victim
Sustain isolation long enough to bias chain/mempool visibility
mitigations: Diversify peer connectivity and avoid single-homing network paths
Run updated Bitcoin Core versions and monitor for tip/peer anomalies

sources.title: Eclipse Attacks on Bitcoin's Peer-to-Peer Network (USENIX 2015)

title: Selfish Mining
summary: A miner withholds valid blocks strategically to increase expected revenue over fully honest publication.
attackerCapabilities: Sufficient hashpower share to make withholding strategy viable
Fast private relay and timing control for strategic release
mitigations: Improve propagation performance to reduce stale-block arbitrage
Maintain hashrate decentralization across independent operators

sources.title: Majority is not Enough: Bitcoin Mining is Vulnerable

title: Fee Sniping
summary: During extreme fee spikes, miners may have incentive to attempt short reorgs to capture recent fee-rich blocks.
attackerCapabilities: Ability to mine on alternate short branches
Economic tolerance for temporary orphan-risk losses
mitigations: Use deeper confirmation policies for high-value settlements
Monitor unusual reorg behavior during abnormal fee regimes

title: Replace-by-Fee Abuse Pattern
summary: Zero-confirmation recipients can be harmed when an attacker replaces a pending transaction with a higher-fee conflict.
attackerCapabilities: Broadcast a replaceable low-fee transaction accepted by the recipient
Issue a higher-fee conflicting replacement before confirmation
mitigations: Avoid zero-confirmation acceptance for sensitive payment values
Use explicit confirmation and mempool monitoring policies

title: Lightning Channel Jamming
summary: Attackers occupy HTLC slots and route capacity to degrade payment success for other users without necessarily stealing funds.
attackerCapabilities: Ability to open/fund channels and issue many strategic payments or HTLCs
Sufficient capital and timing coordination to sustain congestion pressure
mitigations: Use liquidity-aware routing and channel policy tuning to reduce jam impact
Apply operational monitoring and fallback paths, including on-chain settlement when needed

sources.title: Bitcoin Optech topic: channel jamming attacks

title: Lightning Probing and Topology Leakage
summary: Adversarial payment probes can infer channel balances, routing policy, or node behavior, reducing operational privacy.
attackerCapabilities: Ability to send repeated crafted probe payments through target routes
Collection and analysis of failure codes/timing behavior over many attempts
mitigations: Use privacy-preserving routing features and conservative error disclosure
Harden operational policy and monitoring to detect repetitive probe patterns

title: Lightning Pinning and Fee Griefing
summary: Adversaries exploit mempool and fee dynamics to delay or worsen close-path transactions, raising risk/cost during disputes or congestion.
attackerCapabilities: Ability to craft/publish conflicting or pinning transactions around close paths
Economic capacity to sustain fee pressure and exploit confirmation latency
mitigations: Use robust channel/anchor fee-bumping workflows and careful close-path design
Maintain monitoring, watchtower coverage, and conservative risk policy during high-fee periods
